comment_data.body: Do we plan on adding `previousResultIds` to `workspace/diagnostics` too?

 • The `textDocument/completion` request now includes the completion context in
   its parameters.
+• The `textDocument/diagnostic` request now includes the previous id in its

comment_data.body: Why can't we use `util._refresh` here anymore? It handles `only_visible` and cancelling pending requests.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -344,13 +351,38 @@ local function disable(bufnr)
 end
 
 --- Refresh diagnostics, only if we have attached clients that support it
----@param bufnr (integer) buffer number
----@param opts? table Additional options to pass to util._refresh
+---@param bufnr integer buffer number
+---@param client_id? integer Client ID to refresh (default: all clients)
+---@param only_visible? boolean Whether to only refresh for the visible regions of the buffer (default: false)
 ---@private
-local function _refresh(bufnr, opts)
-  opts = opts or {}
-  opts['bufnr'] = bufnr
-  vim.lsp.util._refresh(ms.textDocument_diagnostic, opts)
+local function _refresh(bufnr, client_id, only_visible)
+  if

comment_data.body: We'll want to set `client_result_id = {}` when disabling diagnostics: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/f1422a313fa57c8c7045163aa209a9fd9166fe5a/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/diagnostic.lua#L341

It is necessary to obtain `bufstate.client_result_id`, which is a private variable of this module, and it is not very appropriate to modify `util._refresh` to allow it to accept such a parameter that has a specific purpose.

I think the main purpose of `only_visible` is to add an `lsp.Range` representing the user-visible area of a buffer to the params sent to the LSP server. However, `textDocument/diagnostic` does not accept this parameter; it is redundant. So the actual role of `only_visible` is only to ensure that the buffer sending the request is visible otherwise do nothing. I still doubt whether this guarantee has any practical significance, so it might even be worth considering removing this parameter. To be cautious, I just kept the former logic.

Another usage of `util._refresh` is in `inlay_hint.lua`. It does not use `only_visible` and is simpler. Therefore, I am also considering removing `util._refresh` because it is of little use and quite complex.

+---@param only_visible? boolean Whether to only refresh for the visible regions of the buffer (default: false)
 ---@private
-local function _refresh(bufnr, opts)
-  opts = opts or {}
-  opts['bufnr'] = bufnr
-  vim.lsp.util._refresh(ms.textDocument_diagnostic, opts)
+local function _refresh(bufnr, client_id, only_visible)
+  if

comment_data.body: When we disable diagnostics, we are simply stopping the client from sending requests to the server. This decision should be unknown to the server, so I think it might be better to keep it here.

+• The `textDocument/diagnostic` request now includes the previous id in its

comment_data.body: I must be missing something: How is that related to not clearing the result IDs?
Oh lol I should have checked that first.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -315,6 +315,8 @@ LSP
   `codeAction/resolve` request.
 • The `textDocument/completion` request now includes the completion context in
   its parameters.
+• The `textDocument/diagnostic` request now includes the previous id in its

comment_data.body:
I may not have made my point clear: I don't think they should be cleared after diagnostics is disabled.

The current behavior is that result IDs remain after being disabled. When diagnostics are enabled again, we could send the stored result IDs as the "previous result IDs" of the upcoming requests. 

I think that's more consistent because they should share the same lifecycle with clients, not whether users disable them.

comment_regular_data.body: This PR was previously frozen due to the release of 0.11. Now that 0.11 has been released, can we review it again?
